image.altText: A hole in the door, messy on the floor, dirty carpet and broken furniture are visible

props.synopsis: People with mental illness are getting lost in the NDIS system, isolated from friends and family and abandoned while their lucrative government funding is drained. This is how they're living.

title.children: Inside a squalid house linked to a suspected NDIS fraudster

image.altText: AI security scanning machine outside MCG entrance

props.synopsis: Since a major security breach at Australia's biggest sports ground, questions are being asked about the security screening technology being used — the first of its type in Australia.

title.children: AI security experts argue MCG gun breach wasn't just 'human error'

image.altText: Small dead fishes at the shore of the beach at Loch Sport

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating why thousands of dead fish washed up on the shore of the regional Victorian town of Loch Sport. But locals are worried they will be left without an answer again.

title.children: Loch Sport locals worried by another mass fish death on pristine beach

image.altText: A plant with a long stem and purple flowers on the end

props.synopsis: There are tens of thousands of exotic ornamental plants sold in Australian nurseries but fewer than a quarter have been assessed for their potential to become an invasive weed.

title.children: Garden stores a 'hot mess' of what could be the next invasive weeds

image.altText: Indian and Australian cricket players crowd around a trophy in a handover ceremony.

props.synopsis: The famed cricketing rivalry between Australia and India has at times become a heated affair. The Almond Ashes between the two nations faced no such problems.

title.children: Almond Ashes brings together Aussie growers and their Indian buyers

image.altText: Mokbel - family

props.synopsis: The notorious underworld drug trafficker has begun his first full day of freedom with a morning walk, a police check-in and a jaunt to Northland Shopping Centre.

title.children: Crime figure Tony Mokbel marks first full day of freedom with morning walk, trip to cop shop

image.altText: man with blue shirt, beige white brimmed hat pushes green radar resembling a lawn mower amid headstones

props.synopsis: The discovery of 67 possible unmarked graves at a western Victorian cemetery heightens calls for more funding to map graveyards to avoid accidentally digging into occupied plots.

title.children: Unmarked graves a hidden challenge in cemeteries running out of space

image.altText: A man with black hair and shaved sides, wearing a black jacket stands on a footpath looking at a black car driving past.

props.synopsis: Police have charged a 23-year-old from Narre Warren with murder over the August 2023 shooting of Mohammed Keshtiar.

title.children: Man, 23, charged in Melbourne with murder of crime figure

image.altText: Man looking over his reading glasses

props.synopsis: Petro Georgiou held the seat of Kooyong in Melbourne's inner east for 16 years and was outspoken about the rights of immigrants and asylum seekers.

title.children: Former federal Liberal MP Petro Georgiou dies at 77

image.altText: A truck stopped on a closed road.

props.synopsis: Police say a passer-by found the remains on the Victorian Highway at Kiata, which has been closed in both directions.

title.children: Human remains found on Victorian highway after possible hit and run

image.altText: A man in a green fire suit and white hard hat inspects a burnt tree in a scorched landscape.

props.synopsis: For the first time this Victorian bushfire season, a specialist Indigenous team protected sacred sites from the Grampians and Little Desert blazes, preventing important art and history from turning to ash.

title.children: Racing the flames to save sacred First Nations cultural sites

image.altText: A sign saying "Victorian Desalination Plant" next to a road, under a blue sky with clouds.

props.synopsis: Victoria's desalination plant is set to be switched on for the first time in years. During its period of prolonged dormancy, the government has been paying billions in repayments for the plant.

title.children: Victoria's billion-dollar desalination plant restarting after years of inactivity

image.altText: a silhouette of a man in a wheelchair in a room

props.synopsis: Jim* moved into an apartment rented by a disability company linked to suspected NDIS fraudster Khawaja Haroon. He's now facing homelessness and has paid thousands of dollars of his NDIS funding for services he didn't receive.

title.children: 59yo's eviction linked to suspected multi-million-dollar NDIS scam

image.altText: A highway patrol car blocking a road and police tape

props.synopsis: An investigation is underway after police shot a woman armed with a gun in Mulgrave this morning.

title.children: Armed woman shot by police in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: a photo of a man's face with a very swollen, very bruised black eye and blood on his face

props.synopsis: A man asks why it took months to interview a man in relation to his assault, as Victoria's police union reveals about 800 officers are on sick leave.

title.children: 'Nearly killed me': After four months, man interviewed and released over roadside assault

image.altText: A fire truck drives down a residential street near police vehicles.

props.synopsis: A woman has died and two other family members have been injured trying to escape a house fire in Victoria's north west.

title.children: One dead, two injured trying to escape Victorian house fire

image.altText: Two man sitting next to each other in a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Residents and businesses in a Victorian town hit by a major hailstorm six months ago say insurance companies are moving too slow and offering paltry payouts.

title.children: Restaurant owners with $90k hail bill offered $28k by insurer

image.altText: Close up of flowers at base of tree and tributes written.

props.synopsis: Detectives have arrested two teenagers in relation to an alleged car theft, which they allege is linked to another stolen car that crashed into a tree, killing two boys.

title.children: Police arrest two teens over car theft in relation to fatal collision

image.altText: Yellow lights on ground between trees at night.

props.synopsis: A $4-million art project in Victoria's north-west will open today, but it's been the focus of controversy in the Mildura community over ticket prices, which locals say are unaffordable.

title.children: Locals take dim view of prices as Mildura turns on $4m light show

image.altText: A man Middle Eastern in appearance, aged between 25-30 years old and with a slim build wearing orange hoodie

props.synopsis: Katie Tangey, 27, died after the house she was sitting was firebombed by mistake earlier this year. Investigators say they've made progress but are seeking more information.

title.children: Police release image of man connected to fatal fire in Melbourne's west

image.altText: Barbed wire

props.synopsis: The Asylum Seeker Resource Centre says a riot started at Melbourne Immigration Detention Centre when frustrations about healthcare boiled over.

title.children: Concerns over detainee welfare at immigration detention centre

image.altText: Piles of giant logs lying next to a forest of Australian native trees.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has tasked councils with approving native timber logging projects for private land, which can allow harvesting despite statewide bans.

title.children: Loophole in timber logging ban leaves ecologist baffled

image.altText: Luke Beveridge walking during the Bulldogs win over Carlton

props.synopsis: Luke Beveridge believes coaches are 'helpless' surrounding guiding players how to tackle and says even umpires are unsure on how to correctly penalise tackling in the AFL.

title.children: Bulldogs coach slams AFL rules, claims 'the whole competition is confused'

image.altText: Firefighters watch a high energy fire in the Grampians area of western Victoria

props.synopsis: Legislation to replace Victoria's Fire Services Levy with an expanded tax could be voted through by the Legislative Council today, but farmers are calling for it to be blocked.

title.children: Fire levy changes have Victorian farmers fuming ahead of vote

image.altText: A row of solar panels are stood in the ground above red dirt

props.synopsis: Locals in renewable energy hotspots say they have been forced to create their own information groups to address concerns about the rapid energy transition and want the government to pitch in.

title.children: Plea for federal funds to grow community trust in renewable zones

image.altText: A group of schoolboys wearing shorts walks in a park, you can only see them from the waist down

props.synopsis: Logos will be banned from some Victorian public school uniform items in new rules to help families with the cost of living.

title.children: Victoria to ban state school logos on ‘below-the-waist’ uniform items

image.altText: daniel andrews tours ballarat's eureka stadium at announcement of 2026 commonwealth games

props.synopsis: The final parliamentary report into the withdrawal from the 2026 Commonwealth Games has named key ministers it found responsible for the cancellation, and accused the state government of impeding the collection of vital evidence.

title.children: Daniel Andrews, Jacinta Allan named in report into cancelled Commonwealth Games

image.altText: NSW Police tape

props.synopsis: The young child remains in hospital in a serious condition, and the driver is assisting police.

title.children: Child suffers life-threatening injuries after being hit by teenage driver

image.altText: close up of a woman's blotchy face

props.synopsis: A customer suffering a severe reaction to a skincare balm says she warned Kmart a month before a teen was hospitalised.

title.children: Calls for regulation as another Kmart customer experiences skin damage

image.altText: Sidney Rios looking at cross

props.synopsis: Shincheonji calls itself a religious organisation based on the teachings of the Bible, but former members say there is a much darker side — one that consumes its members' lives, controls their movements and uses threats of divine retribution to prevent them from leaving.

title.children: From Bible study to 'brainwashed': How an international church is recruiting

image.altText: Golden cliffs above a blue-green sea on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Local communities say they need help managing overtourism as mass visitation creates issues for wildlife, raises evacuation concerns, and poses safety risks.

title.children: Communities grapple with overtourism as social media fuels popularity

image.altText: Rick Nugent, dressed in a police uniform, stands a lectern indoors.

props.synopsis: Rick Nugent confirms he will not apply for the ongoing position but says he is still Victoria's acting chief commissioner amid media reports.

title.children: Victoria's top cop Rick Nugent confirms he won't apply for ongoing job

image.altText: red sherrin football to sitting on green grass with football goal posts and football club in the background

props.synopsis: Andrew Krakouer, who played 137 AFL games for Richmond and Collingwood, has died age 42.

title.children: 'He loved everyone': AFL world reacts to death of Andrew Krakouer, aged 42

image.altText: A slow shutter speed blurs the movement of two horses training at a racetrack.

props.synopsis: Workers in the racing industry across Australia say horses are being routinely drugged for track work at the peril of rider and horse safety in a malpractice which could breach nation-wide racing rules.

title.children: Routine drugging of race horses 'disaster waiting to happen'

image.altText: A blue car is parked across a roadway that has houses and cars on both sides and is taped off with police tape.

props.synopsis: Masi Ayiik, who was shot by police after allegedly chasing officers with a metal pole, had allegedly breached his visa conditions several times, a Victorian court has heard.

title.children: Former immigration detainee seeks bail after police shooting
